definition[0]: to make someone cry, be silent etc
example[0]: She was reduced to tears in front of her students.
definition[1]: to make someone do something they would rather not do, especially when it involves behaving or living in a way that is not as good as before
example[1]: Eventually Charlotte was reduced to begging on the streets.
definition[2]: to destroy something, especially a building, completely
example[2]: A massive earthquake reduced the city to rubble.
definition[3]: to change something into a shorter simpler form
example[3]: Many jobs can be reduced to a few simple points.
